item.title: Tejas Networks Ltd Hits Intraday High with 7.19% Surge on 30 Jan 2026
item.description: Tejas Networks Ltd demonstrated robust intraday strength on 30 Jan 2026, surging to a day’s high of Rs 351.55, marking a 7.84% increase from its previous close. This performance notably outpaced the broader Telecom - Equipment & Accessories sector and the Sensex, underscoring significant trading momentum amid a volatile market backdrop. Time: 16 minutes ago

item.title: Lakshmi Electrical Control Systems Q3 FY26: Profitability Collapse Raises Serious Concerns
item.description: Lakshmi Electrical Control Systems Limited (LECSL), a Coimbatore-based manufacturer of control panels and plastic components, reported deeply troubling Q3 FY26 results that have sent alarm bells ringing among investors. The company plunged into a net loss of ₹1.05 crores for the quarter ended December 2025, marking a dramatic reversal from the ₹0.48 crores profit reported in Q2 FY26 and a stark 892.30% collapse compared to the ₹0.13 crores profit in Q3 FY25. The stock reacted sharply, declining 5.53% to close at ₹756.50 on January 30, 2026, as the micro-cap company's market capitalisation stood at ₹185.95 crores. Time: 31 minutes ago

item.title: Saptak Chem & Business Ltd Hits All-Time High at Rs.45.92
item.description: Saptak Chem & Business Ltd has reached an all-time high of Rs.45.92 today, underscoring a remarkable rally that has propelled the stock to new heights within the Trading & Distributors sector. This milestone reflects sustained strong performance and significant gains over multiple timeframes, positioning the company prominently in the market landscape. Time: 31 minutes ago

item.title: Arvind Ltd Q3 FY26: Margin Expansion Drives Steady Performance Despite Volume Pressures
item.description: Arvind Ltd., one of India's leading vertically integrated textile manufacturers with nearly eight decades of industry presence, delivered a stable performance in Q3 FY26 with consolidated net profit of ₹97.59 crores, registering a marginal decline of 5.62% quarter-on-quarter but down 5.64% year-on-year. The ₹7,951 crore market capitalisation company, which operates across denim, shirting, knits and garments, demonstrated operational resilience through margin expansion even as revenue growth remained muted. The stock rallied 4.62% following the results announcement, closing at ₹311.30 on January 30, 2026, as investors responded positively to the improved profitability metrics. Time: 32 minutes ago
